oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Tom Douglas - 2018-01-06
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Tom Douglas from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on January 6, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom Douglas;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments by Abi Tapia begins in progress with introduction of Tom Douglas / (04:10) Opening comments by Tom / (04:50) Introduction of first song / (06:45) Performs Meanwhile Back At Mama's / (10:41) Talks about the amount of songs he's written, his songwriting history and intros the next song / (14:00) Performs Little Rock / (18:26) Talks about his emotional performance of the previous song / (19:14) Intros next song / (21:45) Performs Southern Voice / (25:49) Answers question from the audience about who he likes to song write for the most / (26:52) Answers question about who has recorded more of his songs / (28:3) Answers question about co-writing and where song ideas come from / (31:01) Intros the next song / (32:40) Takes break while forgetting the song / (34:35) Performs song likely titled This Holy Thing Called Love / (38:11) Talks about running in the Nashville marathon and the inspiration he got from a t-shirt / (39:56) Performs I Run To You /
(42:49) Intros next song / (43:49) Performs The House That Built Me / (48:16) Final comments / (48:31) Walk-out music / (51:06) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Douglas, Tom; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
